CWE-79.name: Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
CWE-79.description: Improper neutralization of input during web page generation
patterns: unsanitized user input in HTML output
CWE-79.remediation: Use context-aware encoding, Content Security Policy, and avoid innerHTML with user data

CWE-89.name: SQL Injection
CWE-89.description: Improper neutralization of special elements used in an SQL command
CWE-89.remediation: Use parameterized queries, prepared statements, or ORM methods

CWE-78.name: OS Command Injection
CWE-78.description: Improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS command
CWE-78.remediation: Use subprocess without shell, validate and sanitize input, use allowlists

CWE-22.name: Path Traversal
CWE-22.description: Improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory
CWE-22.remediation: Validate and sanitize paths, use absolute paths with allowlists, chroot when possible

CWE-502.name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
CWE-502.description: Deserialization of untrusted data without proper validation
CWE-502.remediation: Avoid deserializing untrusted data, use safe serialization formats (JSON), validate schemas

CWE-352.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
CWE-352.description: Missing or improper validation of CSRF tokens
CWE-352.remediation: Implement CSRF tokens, use SameSite cookies, verify origin headers

CWE-434.name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
CWE-434.description: Upload of file with dangerous type without proper validation
CWE-434.remediation: Validate file types, use allowlists, scan for malware, store outside web root

CWE-798.name: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
CWE-798.description: Use of hard-coded credentials in source code
CWE-798.remediation: Use environment variables, secrets management, credential rotation

CWE-327.name: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
CWE-327.description: Use of broken or risky cryptographic algorithm
CWE-327.remediation: Use modern algorithms (AES-256, SHA-256+), secure random generators, proper key management

CWE-306.name: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
CWE-306.description: Missing authentication for a function that requires authentication
CWE-306.remediation: Require authentication for all sensitive operations, implement proper session management

CWE-862.name: Missing Authorization
CWE-862.description: Missing authorization check for sensitive operations
CWE-862.remediation: Implement authorization checks, use role-based access control, validate permissions

CWE-311.name: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
CWE-311.remediation: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit, use strong encryption, protect keys

CWE-400.name: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
CWE-400.description: Uncontrolled resource consumption leading to DoS
CWE-400.remediation: Implement resource limits, rate limiting, input validation, timeout mechanisms

CWE-94.name: Code Injection
CWE-94.description: Improper control of generation of code
CWE-94.remediation: Avoid code execution with user input, use safe templating, sandbox execution

CWE-20.name: Improper Input Validation
CWE-20.remediation: Validate all input, use strong typing, implement bounds checking, sanitize data
